content: the row below it round 1 k all round 2 k4 ssk k2tog 6 round 3 ssk k2tog k2 4 round 4 k2 k2tog 3 thread yarn thru all stitches to bind off i don t bother stuffing this face choose an appropriate felt for your desired face the larger the leaf the stiffer the felt required cut out a nose rectangle the size you wish fold in half and cut your shape fold your leaf wherever you want an eye placement of this depends on what type of leaf your mouth or nose hole to easily cut the features don t korok is wearing refer to your preferred korok to be too worried about perfection here any mistake judge how high/low on the body this goes just gives your friend more personality embroider a border around and veins inside your leaf using pu 3 stitches 2 from one row and 1 from the row backstitch pass the nose through its hole and tack below it s really just a bit of icord the leaf down rounds 1-2 k all round 3 k2tog k1 round 4 k2tog thread yarn thru to bind off as usual copyright 2018 seth mungons please share this pattern knit yourself into the 900 club hide your koroks around your home your apartment building your town the world craft them into a wreath place them in every garden pot hang them at every window gift one to a deserving friend a distant loved one that 5 year old at the library your neighbor or your favorite barista enter it into your local/state fair show it off at your lys be proud of your work celebrate the outdoors exploration and playfulness go ahead & sell your koroks etsy local trade fair the farmer s market in the alley behind your house whatever works for you just… please don t sell without proper design attribution i worked hard on this it s free for a reason i want anyone who can to make their own designed by esoterictriangle is easy to slap on the listing/tag/alley wall thanks
